body:
So as many people have been saying lately, Avicus is almost dead. To me, it is currently on life support and won't recover. The only choice is to turn the life support off and let it die.

So here is my question:
Who's ingenious idea was it to kill McZone and bring in Avicus and why?

I'm sure I speak for many others when I say I had so much more fun on McZone and would love to see it brought back. Who knows, we might even get some old players back!

Anyway guys, what's your opinion on this?

Cheers,
Keatoboy

replies.body:
Ladies and gentlemen if I could insert my two cents here... So far I'm seeing people either placing the blame on change or Mojang. But I do believe it would be better to credit the school year(my short term memory just made me forget who exactly mentioned it) for the lack of quality or business.

I have been a part of a community that has had its ups and downs. I will not mention the game this is on but the community is mainly known as "Scarecrow" or "Death Tower". I've been part of said community for years before my friend introduced me to MCZone and there's always a pattern of it's yearly population. Some people came, some people went. But during the summer it was at it's busiest and during school years(fall through bits of winter and spring) the population would drop to a handful still being active and would then pick back up where it started. This is what usually happens to any forum/community. No need to worry so much. Addtionally, I'd like to point out that Avicus was mainly to help improve the way the server ran, correct? In terms of game quality, I say it's only increased save for Elimination's lack of players. But that's another rant for another day. Agreed?

replies.body: Well, if you really feel the way you feel, I guess you are giving up on us. I accept that, but don't be surprised when we turn around for the better. The reason we changed MC Zone to Avicus was because of the player count going tremendously downhill, the numerous bugs, and all around lack of design in the games. I guarantee if we would have stayed as MC Zone, we would be in the same (if not worse) situation we are in now. MC Zone was relatively the same thing as Avicus, except with 5 times as many bugs and a pretty bad website. We barely changed anything when updating to Avicus, this includes took out games that were not being played (had 5 players on maximum), updated anticheat, released updated website, and made the server less laggy. If you see any problems with the above changes, then I respect that. I really don't see your logic, but whatever floats your boat. And don't give up on us too quickly, we have a major update planned, so I suggest that you don't miss it.

replies.body:
The thing that would help the server is not another " Major life changing update, that does nothing more then align us better to like servers". Avicus does not have the Dev staff to start talking about a update that is " Network" changing. We don't compete in the space with the big servers that create unique games and unique functionality. Add to that a network owner that has very little activity on the server, and even less voice and you get a Network that is by default going to fail. I do hear a lot of excuses and history lessons like " McZone was on the down slide", and school is back in, and "Life" and time zones, and a million other excuses that are really nothing more than smoke screens for Avicus being neglected by an owner that no longer has the time or the desire to invest.

 Don't get me wrong, I really like the Avicus Network, I like the staff, and have nothing against the Owner,but the facts are what they are - Other servers are growing, other server owners are active in the server and in the forums, other networks have game modes being updated and changes that improve the server on a regular basis. We do not have that, sadly.
